4335614141,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-lisbon-or-porto-at-bnp-paribas-personal-finance-4335614141?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=S8n9iI%2FZ2SHR0cs5dFMnNA%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Lisbon or Porto,BNP Paribas Personal Finance,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action
As a Senior Data Analyst you will use data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues in different geographies:
Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!

Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the HUB Analytics Marketing, an innovative and creative department based in Lisbon and Porto. In both locations we offer a hybrid work model.
You will report hierarchically to the Team Leader. The marketing side of the Hub has 3 mid-sized teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Python developers), working together on complex challenges.
The team is new and everyone is growing together. You'll be surrounded by more than 30 colleagues working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences.
We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities.
What do we have to offer you?
This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.
Are you the one we are looking for?
A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field
Strong programming skills in Python (pandas, etc)
Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
Fluency in oral and written English
Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau Software)
Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
Availability for occasional travel in Europe
If you bring all this, a lot of desire, energy and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for ...
We look forward to receiving your application!

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization
What makes us proud as reference employer?
Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with ""an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)""
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the ""Smart Working"" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand

Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day

  • As a Senior Data Analyst you will use data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues in different geographies:
    • Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) on a regular basis

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 27,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.4 billion euros in 2024.

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights? At Inetum, we are looking for a Business Data Analyst to bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring that information is available to support strategic decisions efficiently.
Gather and define business requirements for data initiatives
Extract and analyze data from commercial and analytical systems for ad hoc analysis
Design and structure data models to create valuable products and ensure data consistency
Perform business analysis to support operations and decision-making
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and translate insights into actionable recommendations
Contribute to the evolution of our Data Warehouse and Datahub.
Development of dashboards and data visualization strategies
Creation of documents and reports to support decision-making
Compilation of information and preparation of analytical reports
User Stories for Data Warehouse enhancements
Data modeling within the Data Warehouse
Ad hoc data collection from commercial and analytical systems.
Up to 10 years of experience in similar roles
Advanced knowledge of SQL for data extraction and manipulation
Strong experience with dashboards and data visualization tools
Advanced Excel and proficiency in Office tools
Preferably experience with SAS Enterprise Guide and DOMO
Solid understanding of data modeling and warehousing concepts.

The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide actionable insights for business decisions. Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Job Description:

The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide actionable insights for business decisions. The role involves creating and managing data pipelines using Airflow for data extraction, processing, and loading, ensuring their maintenance, monitoring, and stability. The analyst will work closely with end-users and other teams to provide accessible and reliable data

Main Tasks

  • Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing and loading
  • Responsible for code and query optimization
  • Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks
  • Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users
  • Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost.

Qualifications

Technical Skills:

  • Python
  • Experience in creating APIs in Python
  • PySpark
  • SQL, Oracle Data Base
  • Experience with Data Warehouses
  • Apache Airflow - Experience in pipeline development
  • Git
  • Agile methodologies

Language Skills

  • English ‚Äì Practice

Soft Skills

  • Good communication skills
  • Strong analytical abilities, able to have the right synthesis and all possible details at same timee required soft skills
  • Adaptability skills
  • Team spirit
  • Client Focus

4338434901,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analytics-and-insights-associate-at-amgen-4338434901?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=jXtBtKL1gORfvsnI%2BV0bsw%3D%3D,"Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate",Amgen,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best WorkplacesTM https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ ranking in Portugal in 2024 (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 500 talented people and more than 40 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in people‚Äôs lives.
Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate

You, as our Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate, supports the delivery of day to day D&A activities. You are responsible for producing budgeting and planning reports, data analysis and supporting wider business Units within the ACCP.
Supporting business planning and decision making through financial analysis.
Support long-term and short-term planning support activities.
Collecting feedback and preparing communication plans to share outputs.
Taking ownership of complex calculations through understanding inputs and their relationships to the problem.
Upload, manage and store complex data.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).
Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.
University Degree in commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
1+ years working in a finance/data related field ideally Data and Analytics.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of other MS Office applications, SQL, Hyperion Pillar, Tableau, Anaplan).
What You Can Expect Of Us
Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous AMGEN Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
for a career that defies imagination
In our quest to serve patients above all else, AMGEN is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

4335773937,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-trainee-real-assets-at-bnp-paribas-cib-4335773937?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=ys%2FjsZtHu4ab62oZ2xNsyA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Trainee - Real Assets,BNP Paribas CIB,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","About The Job

Data is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the teams‚Äô performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank‚Äôs assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
Based in Lisbon, the Trainee will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and support the team
Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
Ensure consistency of data between different credit files
Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on progress of credit files
Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretation
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Economics, Accounting or Management
Detail oriented with deep interest in data
Good written/verbal communication skills in English (mandatory)

The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility
BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions
Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.
To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

About The Job

  • Data is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the teams‚Äô performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank‚Äôs assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
  • Based in Lisbon, the Trainee will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and support the team

Your Main Activities Are

  • Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
  • Ensure accuracy of credit data
  • Ensure consistency of data between different credit files
  • Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on progress of credit files
  • Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
  • Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
  • Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
  • Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretation

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Economics, Accounting or Management
  • Detail oriented with deep interest in data
  • Good knowledge of Excel
  • Good written/verbal communication skills in English (mandatory)
  • Ability to collaborate / teamwork
  • Efficient organizational and planning capacities
  • Self-starter, good initiative and flexible

About The Team

  • The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship &

4339227967,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-finance-department-at-tripleten-4339227967?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=a8pT1rMJg1VdKn1KWPSLuw%3D%3D,Data Analyst (Finance Department),TripleTen,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","TripleTen is a service that empowers individuals, regardless of their prior experience, to embark on the exciting and challenging journey of mastering IT professions such as software engineering, data science, business intelligence analytics, and QA engineering in a feasible and accessible way, ultimately leading to employment opportunities.

Our mission is to ensure that every student has the opportunity to successfully master a new profession and become a valuable member of the IT industry. We are successfully producing highly desirable tech professionals in the most competitive EdTech market in the world - the US market.
Maintain and develop financial reporting for all business units (Product, Marketing, HQ)
Analyze key metrics such as First Cash, Bookings, Refunds, Revenue
Supervise revenue recognition process, adapt revenue recognition to the new products
Work on automating financial reports and processes using modern tools (PySpark, Airflow, Tableau)
Develop dashboards and reports for various stakeholders (management, operational teams)
Collaborate closely with the CFO and other teams to create analytics that meet current and strategic business needs.
2+ years of experience as a financial analyst or in a related role
Strong understanding of financial metrics and their impact on business processes (Revenue, Bookings, ARPPU, Cash In, etc.)
Sufficiently proficient in Python and SQL for analytics & automatisation
Working experience on analytics tools required (SQL, Excel, Tableau, Python, PySpark, Airflow)
English proficiency at B2 level or higher.
Able to independently analyze data and generate hypotheses
Extended medical insurance for employees and 80% compensation of insurance for family members (if you are already in Belgrade and join our team there)
A comfortable digital office. We use modern digital tools‚ÄîMiro, Notion, Zoom, etc.‚Äî to make collaborating together process seamless
Professional freedom, where we trust your experience instead of wasting each other's time and effort micromanaging
Tangible results measured by the percentage of students who find a job after completing one of our courses
Growth. Our product is expanding quickly, so it's a great time to get on board and challenge yourself
Diverse and tight-knit team which is spread out across Serbia, the US, Georgia, Armenia, Israel and more.

team.blue is an ecosystem of successful brands working together across regions to provide customers with everything they need to succeed online. 60+ successful brands make up the group
column2: with a team of more than 3000+ experts serving its 3.5 million customers across Europe and beyond.

column1: team.blue's brands are a mix of traditional hosting businesses, offering services from domain names, email, shared hosting, e-commerce and server hosting solutions and specialist SaaS providers offering adjacent products such as compliance, marketing tools and team collaboration products. This broad product offering makes it a one-stop partner for online businesses and entrepreneurs across Europe.

You will be part of the Data & Analytics function, working closely with the Business functions to perform high-impact, advanced analyses and create high-quality, transparent, effective reports, that best support decision making.

As a BI Analyst, you will be part of the central team.blue Data & Analytics team, one of the pillars of team.blue strategy, and the priorities and collaboration in the team are aligned daily with fullinvol vement from team members and the management. You will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that inform business strategies, improve customer processes, and drive overall performance. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and a passionfor uncovering trends and patterns within complex datasets. You will interact directly with several different stakeholders (business functions, product owners, top management, etc.), besides the data engineering part of the team.

You are self-driven, ambitious, collaborative, and able to effectively and independently translate new ideas into concrete measures. You can communicate with all levels of the organization and translate the technical language into a more business-friendly language when translating business requests into technical solutions. Part of the role will be to deliver according to time constraints and focus on more projects simultaneously. The right candidate can cope with this and has a proven track record from similar positions.

Collect, clean, and analyze large volumes of data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. The analytical toolkit ranges from statistics to advanced analytics / machine learning engines, depending on the use case.
Translate data insights into meaningful and actionable recommendations for stakeholders across various departments, understanding business objectives and requirements.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to key decision-makers.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to address specific business questions or challenges, delivering insights that drive continuous improvement.

Be able to understand the technical setup of data sources / structures and interact with the more technical data engineering part of the team, for an efficient workchain ranging from raw data to final business reports.
Understand or quickly learn business concepts in the domains of marketing, finance, PE, M&A and more.
Advanced degree in STEM subjects (Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, etc), Economics, or relevant work experience
At least 5 years of relevant experience, working in business intelligence, ideally in a related industry
Demonstrable track record in developing data intelligence solutions that are stable and high performing
column2: provide business value
column3: and use resources efficiently

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.

Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extraction, processing, and loading

Proficiency in SQL and Oracle Database

4335614139,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/hr-data-analyst-at-bnp-paribas-cib-4335614139?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=vmHPAqe05I4P2Mp87IS8Ag%3D%3D,HR Data Analyst,BNP Paribas CIB,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","About The Job
The Data Officer is in charge of Data Quality framework employments, contribution to Data operational efficiency projects and, also, Data Management support to business lines
Ensure the mastering of the Data Quality as defined by the Group, in alignment with regulations, policies, norms and standards
Ensure Data Quality methodological support and best practices deployment
Support Data Community members such as Data Domain Managers and Data Quality Analysts
Drive and monitor the action plans to address structural data quality issues raised by the group or reported by different domains
Support audits related to HR Data Management and Quality
Collaborate on ad-hoc analysis for the evaluation and improvement of prioritized Data Quality
Build and maintain Power BI dashboards to monitor the officialized KQIs
Analyze the impact of ongoing or upcoming projects, and assessments on Data Quality
Participate and contribute to the Group and data governance bodies
Masters Degree in Data Science, Management, economics or a related field
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions
Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.
To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

About The Job

  • The Data Officer is in charge of Data Quality framework employments, contribution to Data operational efficiency projects and, also, Data Management support to business lines

Your Main Activities Are

  • Ensure the mastering of the Data Quality as defined by the Group, in alignment with regulations, policies, norms and standards
  • Ensure Data Quality methodological support and best practices deployment
  • Support Data Community members such as Data Domain Managers and Data Quality Analysts
  • Drive and monitor the action plans to address structural data quality issues raised by the group or reported by different domains
  • Support audits related to HR Data Management and Quality
  • Collaborate on ad-hoc analysis for the evaluation and improvement of prioritized Data Quality
  • Build and maintain Power BI dashboards to monitor the officialized KQIs
  • Analyze the impact of ongoing or upcoming projects, and assessments on Data Quality
  • Participate and contribute to the Group and data governance bodies

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Masters Degree in Data Science, Management, economics or a related field
  • At least 3 years of experience
  • Fluent in English
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to manage a project
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Why joining BNP Paribas?

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

The Credit Risk Data Analyst Trainee performs continuous data analysis on the group‚Äôs credit risk parameters and their impact on Risk Weight Assets calculation.
Investigate, analyze and control the calculation of Risk Weight Assets, monitor and explain
Participate in testing new implementations, gathering, and documenting data on calculation or systems evolution
Collaborate with internal clients to best understand their needs towards the process and assure continuous improvement
Support, analyze and monitor the information provided for regulatory purposes.
Ensure proper maintenance of documentation of all methodologies, tools, processes and procedures
Continues participation in transversal projects, being a key participant for improvement and decision making
Business degree in Business Administration, Finance, or in a related field
Academic knowledge of credit risk concepts or prudential frameworks
Knowledge of MS Access, SQL, and/or Business Objects
Fluent in English, verbal and written
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Solid adaptation skills and positive team spirit
Ability to work under tight deadlines
Ability to adapt to changing environments
Motivated to work with Big Data

About The Job

  • The Credit Risk Data Analyst Trainee performs continuous data analysis on the group‚Äôs credit risk parameters and their impact on Risk Weight Assets calculation.

Your Main Activities Are

  • Investigate, analyze and control the calculation of Risk Weight Assets, monitor and explain
  • Participate in testing new implementations, gathering, and documenting data on calculation or systems evolution
  • Collaborate with internal clients to best understand their needs towards the process and assure continuous improvement
  • Support, analyze and monitor the information provided for regulatory purposes.
  • Ensure proper maintenance of documentation of all methodologies, tools, processes and procedures
  • Continues participation in transversal projects, being a key participant for improvement and decision making

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Business degree in Business Administration, Finance, or in a related field
  • Academic knowledge of credit risk concepts or prudential frameworks
  • Experience with MS Office

What good is an award-winning media strategy if not targeted to you?

At dentsu, we hold data very near to our hearts and believe it is a powerful tool used not only to learn more about your customers, but to also discover new, untapped potential. We create meaningful media experiences for clients across major global platforms, original content production, programs and gaming. We bring a cohesive, cross-channel solution to increase performance for every brand we touch.
We develop strategic performance marketing ecosystems.
We create and activate media partnerships and investments.
Build and maintain Power BI dashboards and automated reporting tools to support internal teams and client-facing projects.
Process and analyze data from multiple sources (Excel, SQL, APIs, media platforms) to generate actionable insights.
Collaborate with Media and Strategy teams to ensure data consistency and support performance analysis.
Identify inefficiencies in reporting workflows and implement automation to streamline operations.
Identify new post-campaign analysis and ideas, with a strong focus on performance metrics.
Strong proficiency in Power BI (data modeling, DAX, advanced visualizations).
Advanced Excel skills (formulas, Power Query, macros, pivot tables).
Experience with SQL or other data manipulation tools (preferred).
Knowledge around digital media platforms such as Google Ads, Meta Business Manager, and TikTok Ads is required.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively, manage deadlines, and proactively improve processes.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Management, Marketing, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field (preferred).
Python for data processing and automation (preferred).
Google Tag Manager for tracking and analytics setup.
22 days of holidays + 3 wellness days + Birthday day off

We value the strength diversity brings to our business and are working to build a more inclusive workplace through partnerships with Stonewall, Business Disability Forum and Business in the Community's race and gender equality campaigns. We are happy to discuss all approaches to working for all our roles ‚Äì we can't promise we will offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly.
If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with the recruiter who contacts you.

Job Description:

Company Description

dentsu media

What good is an award-winning media strategy if not targeted to you?

At dentsu, we hold data very near to our hearts and believe it is a powerful tool used not only to learn more about your customers, but to also discover new, untapped potential. We create meaningful media experiences for clients across major global platforms, original content production, programs and gaming. We bring a cohesive, cross-channel solution to increase performance for every brand we touch.

We develop strategic performance marketing ecosystems.

  • Paid search
  • Paid social
  • SEO
  • Programmatic
  • Commerce
  • Affliate Marketing


We create and activate media partnerships and investments.

  • Media supply chain diversification
  • Multicultural market research and activation
  • Scalable media buying
  • Micro-influence strategy and activation


We Create Media-led Experiences.

  • Intelligent content
  • Voice and assistant management
  • Conversion rate optimization


Job Description:

Key Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain Power BI dashboards and automated reporting tools to support internal teams and client-facing projects.
  • Process and analyze data from multiple sources (Excel, SQL, APIs, media platforms) to generate actionable insights.
  • Collaborate with Media and Strategy teams to ensure data consistency and support performance analysis.
  • Identify inefficiencies in reporting workflows and implement automation to streamline operations.
  • Identify new post-campaign analysis and ideas, with a strong focus on performance metrics.


Qualifications

  • Strong proficiency in Power BI (data modeling, DAX, advanced visualizations).
  • Advanced Excel skills (formulas, Power Query, macros, pivot tables).
  • Experience with SQL or other data manipulation tools (preferred).
  • Knowledge around digital media platforms such as Google Ads, Meta Business Manager, and TikTok Ads is required.
  • Analytical mindset with attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively, manage deadlines, and proactively improve processes.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Management, Marketing, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field (preferred).
  • Python for data processing and automation (preferred).
  • Google Tag Manager for tracking and analytics setup.
  • Power Automate for workflow automation.


Additional information

Benefits &
column2:
Perks:

  • Agile work environment
  • 22 days of holidays + 3 wellness days + Birthday day off
  • Healthcare insurance for you!


Inclusion &
column3:
Diversity

We value the strength diversity brings to our business and are working to build a more inclusive workplace through partnerships with Stonewall, Business Disability Forum and Business in the Community's race and gender equality campaigns. We are happy to discuss all approaches to working for all our roles ‚Äì we can't promise we will offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly.

If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with the recruiter who contacts you.

Location:

Lisbon

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Are you passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights and impactful dashboards? Then this position is for you.

Develop advanced Power BI dashboards to visualize business data
Model complex data structures for reporting and analysis
Blend multiple data sources into unified visualizations
Implement best practices in data analytics and visualization

Maintain and update dashboards to reflect current business priorities
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability of published reports
Monitor data flows and troubleshoot issues in reporting pipelines
Provide support to internal/external clients for data interpretation
Continuously optimize performance and usability of dashboards

You have at least 3‚Äì5 years of experience in demanding data analytics or business intelligence environments. You enjoy creating high-impact visualizations, solving complex data challenges, and delivering actionable insights, and are constantly innovating. You have at least 3‚Äì5 years of experience in demanding BI and analytics environments. Power BI development, Data Modeling, Database Management, Data Visualization

4340035657,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-french-speaker-at-natixis-in-portugal-4340035657?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=NQZ%2Bpw0fbZQJpk5WKIl8dw%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst (French Speaker),Natixis in Portugal,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

As part of Groupe BPCE‚Äôs international division, Natixis in Portugal designs and delivers solutions for its two core areas ‚Äî Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äî as well as transversal services that support all entities across the Group.

With more than 3,000 employees representing 46 nationalities, the teams work across Information Technology, Banking Support Activities, and Compliance, in an integrated, inclusive, and cross-functional way, supporting all business lines and platforms of the Group.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.
Job Description: Data Analyst ‚Äì Data BPCE SI ‚Äì P√¥le Transformation et Strat√©gie

Position Overview: We are seeking a skilled professional to join our Squad Data RUN ‚Äì Data Entreprise, dedicated to ensuring the achievement of business objectives and the effective management of daily operations, including incident resolution and necessary evolutions. This role is pivotal in supporting the transformation of our Data product and requires a strong technical background in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and data transformations tools (ETL/ELT).
Integrate into the Performance and Run team, collaborating closely with BPCE-SI business units to guarantee the stability of existing systems.
Manage incidents effectively, ensuring minimal impact on operations while implementing necessary system evolutions.
Develop specific components in the context of construction projects, contributing to the overall enhancement of our data capabilities.
Employ Google Cloud Platform (GCP), particularly BigQuery and Composer, to optimize data management and analysis.
Utilize Power BI for reporting and visualization, alongside data integration tools such as SSIS to ensure seamless data flow.
Work under the supervision of a squad lead to ensure optimal coordination and successful project execution.
Engage in proactive communication with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Technical Stack: BPCE SI cloud ecosystem (Google Cloud Platform, Cloud Platform Data Group - CDPG), BigQuery, Linux, Python, Power BI, Composer, SSIS
Tooling: Jira, Confluence, Clarity, PowerDesigner, DataGalaxy, Dataplex
Proficient in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) with a strong understanding of data management and integration.
Expertise in Power BI and data integration tools (SSIS).
Knowledge of Python and SQL for data analysis and manipulation.
Strong communication skills to liaise with business units effectively.
Experience working in Agile environments, including daily stand-ups and iterative development practices.
User Needs: Ability to understand and prioritize user needs effectively.
Future Potential: Opportunities to engage with data science and AI initiatives.
If you are passionate about data performance and operations and are excited to facilitate business transformations through effective data management, we invite you to apply for this strategic role.

Our workplace reflects the vibrant spirit of our locations, with initiatives such as a Green Transportation Budget, electric bikes and a flexible Hybrid Work Policy. We promote wellbeing through the Honolulu Wellness Club, a Prayer Room, a Lactation Room, and themed Villages that inspire creativity and collaboration. Through our ESG and DEI strategies, we are committed to being inclusive, caring, and fair, ensuring every voice is heard and valued.

Wealth Management ‚Äî as well as transversal services that support all entities across the Group.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Job Description

Job Description: Data Analyst ‚Äì Data BPCE SI ‚Äì P√¥le Transformation et Strat√©gie

Position Overview: We are seeking a skilled professional to join our Squad Data RUN ‚Äì Data Entreprise, dedicated to ensuring the achievement of business objectives and the effective management of daily operations, including incident resolution and necessary evolutions. This role is pivotal in supporting the transformation of our Data product and requires a strong technical background in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and data transformations tools (ETL/ELT).

Key Responsibilities

  • Integrate into the Performance and Run team, collaborating closely with BPCE-SI business units to guarantee the stability of existing systems.
  • Manage incidents effectively, ensuring minimal impact on operations while implementing necessary system evolutions.
  • Develop specific components in the context of construction projects, contributing to the overall enhancement of our data capabilities.
  • Employ Google Cloud Platform (GCP), particularly BigQuery and Composer, to optimize data management and analysis.
  • Utilize Power BI for reporting and visualization, alongside data integration tools such as SSIS to ensure seamless data flow.
  • Work under the supervision of a squad lead to ensure optimal coordination and successful project execution.
  • Engage in proactive communication with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements.

Functional &
column4:
Technical Environment

  • Business Areas: Internal corporate tools
  • Technical Stack: BPCE SI cloud ecosystem (Google Cloud Platform, Cloud Platform Data Group - CDPG), BigQuery, Linux, Python, Power BI, Composer, SSIS

Methods &
column5:
Tools

  • Tooling: Jira, Confluence, Clarity, PowerDesigner, DataGalaxy, Dataplex
  • Testing: Jira Xray
  • Methodology: BPCE Tempo ecosystem (Agile framework)

Qualifications

Requirements:

  • Proficient in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) with a strong understanding of data management and integration.
  • Expertise in Power BI and data integration tools (SSIS).
  • Knowledge of Python and SQL for data analysis and manipulation.
  • Strong communication skills to liaise with business units effectively.
  • Experience working in Agile environments, including daily stand-ups and iterative development practices.

Additional Information

  • User Needs: Ability to understand and prioritize user needs effectively.
  • Language Requirement: French proficiency (B2 level).
  • Future Potential: Opportunities to engage with data science and AI initiatives.

If you are passionate about data performance and operations and are excited to facilitate business transformations through effective data management, we invite you to apply for this strategic role.

Additional Information

Our workplace reflects the vibrant spirit of our locations, with initiatives such as a Green Transportation Budget, electric bikes and a flexible Hybrid Work Policy. We promote wellbeing through the Honolulu Wellness Club, a Prayer Room, a Lactation Room, and themed Villages that inspire creativity and collaboration. Through our ESG and DEI strategies, we are committed to being inclusive, caring, and fair, ensuring every voice is heard and valued.

We have a team of over 500 talented people and more than 40 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in people‚Äôs lives.

You, as our Associate Field Excellence, will support the delivery of day to day D&A activities and delivery of sales and activities data to the country teams. The responsibilities include development and maintenance of data model and reporting in Tableau, resource planning and business analysis, performance tracking and monitoring, territory management and data quality and support for the wider business Units within ACCP and AMGEN.
Some of the tasks related to that are:
Maintaining internal databases (master data, data validation, etc.)
Using reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau) to develop new and maintain existing reporting dashboards and to deliver insight and drive action for the affiliate teams
Developing new and existing data models that are tailored to create insights about the sales of AMGEN‚Äôs products
Build data governance with scalable processes, refresh scheduling, security, and monitoring of report quality
Providing training and support on the internal CRM system
Providing support on Plan of Action (POA) and SIP (Sales Incentive Plan) processes
Support on capacity calculation and territories
Write Technical documentation of data models and applications
Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement)
Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.
University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Healthcare, Business or Data
1+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
Strong knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel and PPT)
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
Consistent track record of achieving desired results
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Medium knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
Knowledge of at least one ETL (Alteryx and Tableau Prep preferred)
What You Can Expect Of Us
Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous AMGEN Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Proven experience and skills needed:

  • University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Healthcare, Business or Data
  • 1+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
  • Strong knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel and PPT)
  • Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
  • Consistent track record of achieving desired results
  • Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
  • Communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Medium knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
  • Medium knowledge of SQL

Preferred Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
  • Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
  • Knowledge of at least one ETL (Alteryx and Tableau Prep preferred)
  • Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry

THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us

  • Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
  • A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
  • Generous AMGEN Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
  • Flexible work arrangements.

APPLY NOW

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Ferrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella¬Æ, Tic Tac¬Æ, Ferrero Rocher¬Æ, Raffaello¬Æ, Kinder Bueno¬Æ and Kinder Surprise¬Æ. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in more than 50 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? 53,000 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.

Step into an exciting opportunity as a Business Intelligence TKM Analyst where your analytical mindset will make a real impact. In this role, you will be at the heart of data analysis, category reporting, and channel management, ensuring that our sales performance tracking and trade marketing activities run seamlessly. Additionally, you‚Äôll collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver insights that shape strategic decisions and drive growth in the Modern Trade and Out-of-Home (OOH) channels.

You will monitor and audit All Inclusive Contracts, ensuring compliance with our Pay for Performance principles. Your day will involve tracking in-store activities, supporting the closure of Binding Orders, and managing external data sources to guarantee consistency and accuracy. Furthermore, you‚Äôll coordinate sell-out data sharing with key customers and provide deep-dive analysis to Sales, Marketing, and Trade Marketing teams. Beyond reporting, you‚Äôll contribute to projects like MYPS (My Perfect Store) and SFA reporting, while developing innovative tools to monitor business performance and optimize processes.

You are detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about turning data into actionable insights. A degree in Management, Economics, or similar fields is essential, along with strong skills in Excel, PowerPoint, and SAP. Fluency in Portuguese will set you apart, and your ability to communicate complex information clearly will make you a trusted partner across teams. If you thrive in dynamic environments and love working on business intelligence, data-driven decision-making, and trade marketing analysis, this role is for you.

Ferrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.

Lugar de trabajo: Lisboa ]

Lisboa

As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in more than 50 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. Step into an exciting opportunity as a Business Intelligence TKM Analyst where your analytical mindset will make a real impact. Additionally, you‚Äôll collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver insights that shape strategic decisions and drive growth in the Modern Trade and Out-of-Home (OOH) channels.

We believe in a culture of inclusion, where everyone has a place and all applications are considered based on merit, without discrimination.
This is your opportunity to join an international group with a project that needs you to help meet the challenges of digital transformation.
We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Client Development Data Analyst for a national project.
Analysis of internal and external data to identify business growth opportunities
Ensure we are delivering on our KPIs to support the client strategy and roadmap
Support to team specialists in London, New York and Hong Kong to be more rigorous on the sales process globally, providing all the necessary information and tools to drive accurate business decisions
Promotion and contribution to report automation for a greater level of client intelligence and information-sharing
Data accuracy and integrity across multiple data streams and dashboards
Produce relevant and added value reports and documentation, to be used in regional and global client reviews
Leverage on the data available, internal or external, to provide useful insights on business performance
Promote automation of Client Development deliverables, in partnership with the business and the IT teams
Supervise, assure and promote client data quality in an efficient way.
Proven professional experience in similar roles
Solid knowledge of Data Visualisation Blending Abalytics Tools (Tableau, Power BI)
Experience with IT Languages (Python, mainly Pandas)
Knowledge of SQL and ETL Processes
Solid knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing
‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us
Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.
You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.
By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and an employee assistance program for you and your family (Psychological, Legal, Psychosocial, and Financial support).

4341913835,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-engineer-at-bose-corporation-4341913835?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=IMBVQUieDeIMUswvVfzwmg%3D%3D,Data Analytics Engineer,Bose Corporation,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","At Bose Corporation, we believe sound is the most powerful force on earth ‚Äî and for over 60 years, we have been a company built on innovation, excellence, and independence. Privately owned, fiercely customer-focused, and driven by our values, we continue to lead industries and transform lives through sound.

Today, Bose Corporation is entering an exciting new era. Across multiple global Business Units and Global Functions, we are shaping the future of audio technology, automotive, luxury, and premium experiences. We invite you to join us in this transformation.

Bose is about better sound, but better sound is just the beginning. We‚Äôre about inventing new technologies that truly benefit people and creating a culture where innovation and teamwork are highly valued. Working at Bose, you‚Äôre encouraged to question conventional thinking in the relentless quest to create products and experiences that change people's lives. Data analytics and data science are a crucial part of our mission, fueling the creation of new and innovative products, helping us to bring the right products to the right customers, and allowing us to astonish customers with carefully crafted and personalized experiences.

We are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer within our Data and Analytics Center of Excellence in our Lisbon Hub. The mission of this team is to develop world-class data science, machine learning, and statistical solutions to extract insights and enable data driven decisions that improve our business and enhance customer experiences.

This Data Analytics Engineer role will be critical to help drive analysis, data science, and reporting across many diverse data sets to make sure we deliver impact from our data products and services. This includes working with raw data sets that leads to development of logical and physical data models, data wrangling and design / building of semantic layer that helps to create dashboards and models that drive insights and actions. This work will directly inform and influence multiple division‚Äôs strategies. This is a unique opportunity to shape the experiences, technologies, and products that millions of people will use.

The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of data modeling, SQL, data warehouses / data lake and data engineering skills. You will often serve as an internal expert about the data, what it means and how it can be used to solve business problems. You can demonstrate that you have experience deeply understanding the data structure and transformations required to develop a semantic layer for data analysts and scientists. We are seeking a highly motivated, detail-oriented engineer who is passionate about data and enabling data-driven decisions.

Leverage DBT to mine, analyze, and transform large structured and unstructured datasets, collaborating with analysts, data scientists, and business users to create actionable metrics and datasets that solve business questions.
Provide expertise in query building and data modeling to ensure data is made available in a timely, efficient, and comprehendible means.
Help define the strategy and standards for analytical engineering.
Help define testing and data quality programs leveraging dbt Cloud.
Partner with our other teams to ensure documentation, privacy, and best in class coding practices are implemented within Analytical engineering.
Act as SME for specific data domains by enabling analytical data sets for ad-hoc analysis.
Engage with key stakeholders in the business, product and software teams to clearly understand and scope analytical requests.

Proven expertise in architecting scalable data models in dbt/Snowflake, with a deep understanding of the distinction between analytical models built for specific business users or groups and foundational, reusable data models that enable enterprise-wide analytics.
Strong technical skills, including experience with architecture, analytics, query design and data modeling and tools like Snowflake, dbt, GitHub, AWS, etc.
Excellent communication skills, and the ability to explain deep technical results to diverse groups of stakeholders.
A life-long learner who is curious, has a passion for solving hard, ill-defined problems, has comfort taking initiative and who continuously seeks to improve their skills and understanding.
Demonstrated ability to thrive in Agile teams as well as work independently to deliver high-quality outcomes.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in math, physics, computer science, engineering, business, finance, marketing, economics or related quantitative or computational field.
3+ years of related data analytics experience in relevant consulting, finance, data science or market intelligence functions.
Previous experience in a consumer electronics environment, particularly in a technical field, is a definite plus.
Previous experience with mobile app data is a plus.
Be a part of and work with a top notch, multidisciplinary, transparent, and agile team.
Collaborate with people like you who want to solve problems and have fun together.
Work on developing innovative Wellness products that improve people's lives.
Excellent work life balance and a continuous learning environment.
Highly competitive package as well as a comprehensive benefits program.
We strive to help our employees and customers reach their fullest potential.
Are you interested in this position?
We‚Äôd love to know you better! Submit your application, by uploading your CV in English via the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button above.
For further information about the position please contact us via Careers_Portugal@bose.com.

Our goal is to create an atmosphere where every candidate feels supported and empowered in the interviewing process. Diversity and inclusion are integral to our success, and we believe that providing reasonable accommodation is not only a legal obligation but also a fundamental aspect of our commitment to being an employer of choice. We recognize that individuals may have different needs and requirements based on their abilities, and we provide reasonable accommodations to ensure ideal conditions are met during the application process.

At Bose Corporation, we believe sound is the most powerful force on earth ‚Äî and for over 60 years, we have been a company built on innovation, excellence, and independence. Privately owned, fiercely customer-focused, and driven by our values, we continue to lead industries and transform lives through sound.

Today, Bose Corporation is entering an exciting new era. Across multiple global Business Units and Global Functions, we are shaping the future of audio technology, automotive, luxury, and premium experiences. We invite you to join us in this transformation.

Job Description

Bose is about better sound, but better sound is just the beginning. We‚Äôre about inventing new technologies that truly benefit people and creating a culture where innovation and teamwork are highly valued. Working at Bose, you‚Äôre encouraged to question conventional thinking in the relentless quest to create products and experiences that change people's lives. Data analytics and data science are a crucial part of our mission, fueling the creation of new and innovative products, helping us to bring the right products to the right customers, and allowing us to astonish customers with carefully crafted and personalized experiences.

We are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer within our Data and Analytics Center of Excellence in our Lisbon Hub. The mission of this team is to develop world-class data science, machine learning, and statistical solutions to extract insights and enable data driven decisions that improve our business and enhance customer experiences.

This Data Analytics Engineer role will be critical to help drive analysis, data science, and reporting across many diverse data sets to make sure we deliver impact from our data products and services. This includes working with raw data sets that leads to development of logical and physical data models, data wrangling and design / building of semantic layer that helps to create dashboards and models that drive insights and actions. This work will directly inform and influence multiple division‚Äôs strategies. This is a unique opportunity to shape the experiences, technologies, and products that millions of people will use.

The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of data modeling, SQL, data warehouses / data lake and data engineering skills. You will often serve as an internal expert about the data, what it means and how it can be used to solve business problems. You can demonstrate that you have experience deeply understanding the data structure and transformations required to develop a semantic layer for data analysts and scientists. We are seeking a highly motivated, detail-oriented engineer who is passionate about data and enabling data-driven decisions.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Leverage DBT to mine, analyze, and transform large structured and unstructured datasets, collaborating with analysts, data scientists, and business users to create actionable metrics and datasets that solve business questions.
  • Provide expertise in query building and data modeling to ensure data is made available in a timely, efficient, and comprehendible means.
  • Help define the strategy and standards for analytical engineering.
  • Help define testing and data quality programs leveraging dbt Cloud.
  • Partner with our other teams to ensure documentation, privacy, and best in class coding practices are implemented within Analytical engineering.
  • Act as SME for specific data domains by enabling analytical data sets for ad-hoc analysis.
  • Engage with key stakeholders in the business, product and software teams to clearly understand and scope analytical requests.

Qualifications

  • Proven expertise in architecting scalable data models in dbt/Snowflake, with a deep understanding of the distinction between analytical models built for specific business users or groups and foundational, reusable data models that enable enterprise-wide analytics.
  • Strong technical skills, including experience with architecture, analytics, query design and data modeling and tools like Snowflake, dbt, GitHub, AWS, etc.
  • Excellent communication skills, and the ability to explain deep technical results to diverse groups of stakeholders.
  • A life-long learner who is curious, has a passion for solving hard, ill-defined problems, has comfort taking initiative and who continuously seeks to improve their skills and understanding.
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in Agile teams as well as work independently to deliver high-quality outcomes.

Education

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in math, physics, computer science, engineering, business, finance, marketing, economics or related quantitative or computational field.

Work Experience

  • 3+ years of related data analytics experience in relevant consulting, finance, data science or market intelligence functions.
  • Previous experience in a consumer electronics environment, particularly in a technical field, is a definite plus.
  • Previous experience with mobile app data is a plus.

What's In It For You

  • Be a part of and work with a top notch, multidisciplinary, transparent, and agile team.
  • Collaborate with people like you who want to solve problems and have fun together.
  • Work on developing innovative Wellness products that improve people's lives.
  • Excellent work life balance and a continuous learning environment.
  • Highly competitive package as well as a comprehensive benefits program.
  • We strive to help our employees and customers reach their fullest potential.

Are you interested in this position?

We‚Äôd love to know you better! Submit your application, by uploading your CV in English via the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button above.

For further information about the position please contact us via Careers_Portugal@bose.com.

‚Äé

Diversity and inclusion are integral to our success, and we believe that providing reasonable accommodation is not only a legal obligation but also a fundamental aspect of our commitment to being an employer of choice. We recognize that individuals may have different needs and requirements based on their abilities, and we provide reasonable accommodations to ensure ideal conditions are met during the application process.

About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are

  • Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
  • Responsible for database production and maintenance.
  • Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
  • Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
  • Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
  • Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
  • Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit

4335892446,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/metadata-analyst-at-touch-inflight-solutions-4335892446?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=w%2BFCEFfyB4z2sEQRKWnOeQ%3D%3D,Metadata Analyst,Touch Inflight Solutions,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","Touch, a Conetic Group company, is a disruptive Content Service Provider focused on delivering exceptional onboard experiences for aircraft and the broader transportation industry. Established in 2011, Touch is headquartered in Miami, with an additional main office in Portugal. At Touch, we understand what makes airlines unique and deliver timely, effective solutions to support them in achieving excellence. We‚Äôre an agile, young-minded, and service-oriented company, always at the forefront of industry innovation. Our qualified, resourceful, and empowered team breathes respect for airlines, suppliers, and one another.

As our Metadata Analyst you will be responsible for the acquisition, management, and quality control of metadata related to in-flight entertainment content. This includes sourcing official metadata, obtaining translations, verifying country ratings, and ensuring accurate title translations. The Metadata Analyst plays a critical role in maintaining the integrity and consistency of metadata across airline entertainment platforms and internal databases. The role demands strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
Collect and organize metadata for in-flight entertainment content, including titles, synopses, cast details, release dates, and genres
Ensure all metadata meets airline specifications and internal quality standards
Secure and verify official metadata from trusted sources
Obtain and validate content translations, title translations, and country-specific ratings
Ensure airline requirement for language assets are available during content discovery
Perform thorough quality checks on gathered metadata to identify and correct inconsistencies, inaccuracies, or formatting issues
Conduct quality assurance on airline portals and onboard entertainment systems post-ingestion to verify accuracy and consistency
Continuously refine metadata workflows to improve accuracy and efficiency
Maintain and continuously update the internal metadata database
Ensure metadata is structured and standardized for efficient retrieval and integration
Collaborate with internal teams to optimize metadata ingestion processes
Identify areas for improvement in metadata handling and propose solutions
Assist in troubleshooting metadata-related issues with internal teams and airline partners.
Ethical, energetic, highly motivated, adaptable, with an enquiring mind and passion for excellence
High attention to detail with ability to spot inconsistencies, errors, and formatting issues
Proactive and solution-oriented mindset with ability to identify problems and propose improvements.

Conetic Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment, where all individuals are treated with respect, dignity, and fairness. We believe in providing equal opportunities for employment and advancement, regardless of factors such as race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic. This policy sets forth our commitment to promoting equal opportunity and diversity within our organization.

Touch, a Conetic Group company, is a disruptive Content Service Provider focused on delivering exceptional onboard experiences for aircraft and the broader transportation industry. Established in 2011, Touch is headquartered in Miami, with an additional main office in Portugal. At Touch, we understand what makes airlines unique and deliver timely, effective solutions to support them in achieving excellence. We‚Äôre an agile, young-minded, and service-oriented company, always at the forefront of industry innovation. Our qualified, resourceful, and empowered team breathes respect for airlines, suppliers, and one another.

About the Role:

As our Metadata Analyst you will be responsible for the acquisition, management, and quality control of metadata related to in-flight entertainment content. This includes sourcing official metadata, obtaining translations, verifying country ratings, and ensuring accurate title translations. The Metadata Analyst plays a critical role in maintaining the integrity and consistency of metadata across airline entertainment platforms and internal databases. The role demands strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Collect and organize metadata for in-flight entertainment content, including titles, synopses, cast details, release dates, and genres
