4335803908,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/surveillance-officer-data-analytics-at-bnp-paribas-cib-4335803908?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=fG%2FU6NZ3a7IJpbelisHOgA%3D%3D,Surveillance Officer - Data Analytics,BNP Paribas CIB,"Porto, Porto, Portugal","About The Job

The program begins with a week of professional training, which will help to enhance your technical and professional skills. You will then be assigned to our regular tasks allowing you to gain the necessary practical knowledge about the business. During the second half of the program you will work on real projects, become part of the teams and gain a real insight into the role. In order for you to gain an understanding of the other areas within Global Markets, we will include you to work-shadowing sessions on the team. In addition, you will attend workshops, including interactive case studies, networking and social events allowing you to meet with some of our senior managers and colleagues across CIB as well as working on individual and team projects.
Support the FOCS and BS&C teams in NY with ad-hoc requests (KPIs, reporting, regulatory, etc.)
Assist in the development of automated tools for monitoring Global Markets Staff and performing customized data analytics
Contribute to the design, implementation and visualizations of the monitoring procedures to more effectively identify actual or potential conduct risk scenarios
Build an end-to-end report by improving the data collection and manipulation as well as developing/improving visualizations to be presented in committees and presentations
Assist in the development of automated tools for monitoring Global Markets Staff and performing customized data analytics
Monitor the communications of the Front Officers of Global Markets, by processing alerts generated by the monitoring tools and escalating suspicious activities
Comply with all applicable legal, regulatory and internal Compliance requirements
Document and appropriately communicate the results of the monitoring and controls to parties involved
column2: Proactively report to stakeholders behaviors or facts that could affect their control environment

column1: Work with the 2nd line of defense, to communicate or obtain any additional information that could allow an in-depth study of potential violations of the rules of ethical behavior.
Provide business expertise and specialist advice when required by the 2nd line of defense for their investigations and analyses of real cases
Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, IT or similar areas (preferential)
At least 2 years of experience in similar roles
Strong analytical, quantitative, and problem solving skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Strong interpersonal skills and a sense of professionalism
Motivated and driven to learn more about Global Markets
Basic Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI) (Mandatory)
This role will support two primary teams within the Global Markets Americas Chief Conduct and Controls Office (CCCO):

Front Office Conduct & Surveillance (FOCS): team monitors trading & sales business activity and electronic Communications, with the objective of deterring, detecting, and preventing Conduct Risk breaches. Team develops automated tools for monitoring and performing customized data analytics.

Business Supervision & Controls (BS&C): team collaborates with Trading, Sales, Structuring, and Risks Management teams (2LOD) to help keep non-financial risks to an acceptable level. BS&C is a key component in the assessment and management of non-financial risks and implementation of the controls framework.
BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions
Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.
To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

In order for you to gain an understanding of the other areas within Global Markets, we will include you to work-shadowing sessions on the team. In addition, you will attend workshops, including interactive case studies, networking and social events allowing you to meet with some of our senior managers and colleagues across CIB as well as working on individual and team projects.

4317315721,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-customer-experience-at-tabby-%D8%AA%D8%A7%D8%A8%D9%8A-4317315721?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=r1Nd3qcRovjIOYBsq%2FK8Nw%3D%3D,"Senior Data Analyst, Customer Experience",Tabby | ÿ™ÿßÿ®Ÿä,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","Department: CX Analytics

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 15 million users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

The company‚Äôs flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 40,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and SHEIN use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.
Tabby generates over $10 billion in annual transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most-reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing FinTech in the GCC region.
Tabby launched in 2019 and has since raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors, and is now valued at $3.3 billion.

As a Customer Experience (CX) Data Analyst, you will play a central role in transforming how we support our customers by leveraging data, automation, and AI. You‚Äôll empower teams with insights, optimize support operations, and co-create intelligent workflows with LLM agents.
This role blends analytics, process optimization, and LLM integration to drive smarter, faster, and more human-centered support experiences.
Analyze large-scale datasets related to agent performance, support interactions and QA.
Write optimized SQL queries using tools like BigQuery and ClickHouse.
Detect behavioral and performance trends among agents and support teams.
Partner with QA to identify root causes in agent behavior and customer issues.
Design and test LLM agents embedded in support flows.
Implement evaluation pipelines (manual + automatic) for LLM response quality using semantic similarity and completion metrics.
Collaborate with AI/ML teams to monitor and improve the performance of LLM agents over time.
Collaborate with Dev teams, request features to enhance LLM agents.
Collaborate with Tools & Processes team to enhance the knowledge base for LLM agents.
Work with Airflow and Python to automate data tasks and support workflows.
Suggest and co-build improvements in agent tooling, ticket routing, and SLA tracking.
Translate business inefficiencies into trackable metrics and measurable outcomes.
Act as an analytical partner to Operations, Support Management, QA, and Training.
Work with Data Engineering to ensure clean, accurate, and well-modeled data pipelines.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations, visualizations, and concise documentation.
3+ years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced, data-heavy environment.
Advanced SQL skills (preferably in BigQuery and/or ClickHouse).
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, automation, and integration tasks.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Metabase, Looker).
Understanding of Airflow, DAG orchestration, and modern data pipelines.
Experience with LLM agents, prompt engineering, and OpenAI API usage.
Ability to translate business questions into structured, testable hypotheses.

column2: able to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders alike.

column1: Upper-Intermediate or higher English proficiency (spoken and written).
We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.
Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, UAE.
We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).
If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Department: CX Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: Anton Filimonov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 15 million users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

The company‚Äôs flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 40,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and SHEIN use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby generates over $10 billion in annual transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most-reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing FinTech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched in 2019 and has since raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors, and is now valued at $3.3 billion.

About The Role

As a Customer Experience (CX) Data Analyst, you will play a central role in transforming how we support our customers by leveraging data, automation, and AI. You‚Äôll empower teams with insights, optimize support operations, and co-create intelligent workflows with LLM agents.

This role blends analytics, process optimization, and LLM integration to drive smarter, faster, and more human-centered support experiences.

What you will be doing

Data Analysis &
column2:
Insights

  • Analyze large-scale datasets related to agent performance, support interactions and QA.
  • Write optimized SQL queries using tools like BigQuery and ClickHouse.
  • Build dashboards in Tableau, Metabase.
  • Detect behavioral and performance trends among agents and support teams.
  • Partner with QA to identify root causes in agent behavior and customer issues.


LLM Agent Development &
column3:
Evaluation

  • Design and test LLM agents embedded in support flows.
  • Implement evaluation pipelines (manual + automatic) for LLM response quality using semantic similarity and completion metrics.
  • Collaborate with AI/ML teams to monitor and improve the performance of LLM agents over time.
  • Collaborate with Dev teams, request features to enhance LLM agents.
  • Collaborate with Tools &
column4:
Processes team to enhance the knowledge base for LLM agents.


Automation &
column5:
Workflow Optimization

  • Work with Airflow and Python to automate data tasks and support workflows.
  • Suggest and co-build improvements in agent tooling, ticket routing, and SLA tracking.
  • Translate business inefficiencies into trackable metrics and measurable outcomes.


Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Act as an analytical partner to Operations, Support Management, QA, and Training.
  • Work with Data Engineering to ensure clean, accurate, and well-modeled data pipelines.
  • Communicate findings clearly through presentations, visualizations, and concise documentation.


What you‚Äôll need

  • 3+ years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced, data-heavy environment.
  • Advanced SQL skills (preferably in BigQuery and/or ClickHouse).
  • Proficiency in Python for data analysis, automation, and integration tasks.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Metabase, Looker).
  • Understanding of Airflow, DAG orchestration, and modern data pipelines.
  • Experience with LLM agents, prompt engineering, and OpenAI API usage.
  • Ability to translate business questions into structured, testable hypotheses.
  • Strong presentation and storytelling skills
column6:
able to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders alike.
  • Upper-Intermediate or higher English proficiency (spoken and written).


    • Job Benefits

    Relocation and Employment

    We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

    Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, UAE.

    What You Can Expect

    • We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
    • A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
    • You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
    • Participation in the company‚Äôs employee stock options program.


    We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

    If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

4335594413,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-ghr-at-bnp-paribas-cib-4335594413?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=5tIYHZHlkbQ5kllL9yUsgQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst - GHR,BNP Paribas CIB,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Analyst, you will build analyses and participate in the development of projects that help make strategic decisions for the function (e.g. Analyzing workforce trends for the general management).
In This Role, Your Missions Will Include
Understand the needs expressed by senior management, HR teams, or the business.
Translate them into an analytical roadmap (scope of analysis, metrics...) to help make decisions.

Develop dashboards (Power BI and Tableau) and written analyses (preparation, exploration, descriptive analysis, data visualization, clustering, machine learning, NLP...) in collaboration with data scientists and data engineers of the team.
Contribute to the monitoring and analysis of workforce trends, from data collection to the delivery of analyses to senior management.
Clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.
This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner‚Ä¶), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.
The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.
With a scientific background, you have experience as an analyst, management controller, auditor, consultant in a quantitative-oriented position.

Pedagogically, you can communicate your statistical analyses and results clearly and intelligibly to different stakeholders, both in writing and orally, adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors.
You have significant experience in data visualization, data preparation and machine-learning.
Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.
Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)
Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and trainings (Proficient)
Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)
MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Mobility is one of the core principles of BNP Paribas career and management strategy, which aims to meet our Employees‚Äô needs for personal development along with ensuring that the company meets the overall business needs. For further details, we invite you to explore the mobility principles available on https://bwelcome.hr.bnpparibas/internalmobility. Before applying, please make sure you discuss it with your manager whose support is critical

4335384711,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/product-analyst-seller-experience-at-tabby-%D8%AA%D8%A7%D8%A8%D9%8A-4335384711?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=r58nJyqs7dPvk%2Be8ybiOmw%3D%3D,"Product Analyst, Seller Experience",Tabby | ÿ™ÿßÿ®Ÿä,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","Department: Marketplace, Analytics

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 15 million users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

The company‚Äôs flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 40,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and SHEIN use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.
Tabby generates over $10 billion in annual transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most-reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing FinTech in the GCC region.
Tabby launched in 2019 and has since raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors, and is now valued at $3.3 billion.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. The Product Analyst will work with our Seller Experience Product team, whose main goal is to improve our sellers‚Äô journeys through internal content management systems and marketplace partners‚Äô personal accounts.
Partner with Product, Merchandising, and ML teams to define and align key operational KPIs
Work on data flow processes like new items onboarding and item grouping
Build and maintain dashboards and metrics for seller performance, catalog quality, and asset completeness
Evaluate and validate ML outputs related to item normalization, attribute extraction, and data quality
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly, highlighting the importance of your insights
Contribute to UX and marketing analytics for external partner communication and activation
Assist in planning necessary data structures and data quality improvements, and build reusable data sources for other data scientists.
Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a data/product analyst
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau / LookerStudio / Amplitude
Experience in planning data structures for new products and features
Confident knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, scikit-learn, etc.)
Basic understanding of working with LLM pipelines
Experience in working with marketplace-related (B2B or B2C) products
Experience with operational analytics is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact with business and product teams. At least an upper-intermediate level of English proficiency is required.
Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team will deliver. Strong motivation to develop your skills with a strong team.
We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.
Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, UAE.
We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).
If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Department: Marketplace, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: Vladislav Oshchepkov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 15 million users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

The company‚Äôs flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 40,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and SHEIN use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby generates over $10 billion in annual transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most-reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing FinTech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched in 2019 and has since raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors, and is now valued at $3.3 billion.

About The Role

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. The Product Analyst will work with our Seller Experience Product team, whose main goal is to improve our sellers‚Äô journeys through internal content management systems and marketplace partners‚Äô personal accounts.

What you will be doing

  • Partner with Product, Merchandising, and ML teams to define and align key operational KPIs
column2: • Work on data flow processes like new items onboarding and item grouping
column3: • Build and maintain dashboards and metrics for seller performance, catalog quality, and asset completeness
column4: • Evaluate and validate ML outputs related to item normalization, attribute extraction, and data quality
column5: • Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly, highlighting the importance of your insights
column6: • Contribute to UX and marketing analytics for external partner communication and activation
column7:
• Assist in planning necessary data structures and data quality improvements, and build reusable data sources for other data scientists.


    • What you will need

    • Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a data/product analyst
column9: • Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau / LookerStudio / Amplitude
column10: • Experience in planning data structures for new products and features
column11: • Confident knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, scikit-learn, etc.)
column12: • Basic understanding of working with LLM pipelines
column13: • Experience in working with marketplace-related (B2B or B2C) products
column14:
• Experience with operational analytics is a plus.
  • Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact with business and product teams. At least an upper-intermediate level of English proficiency is required.
  • Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team will deliver. Strong motivation to develop your skills with a strong team.


    • Job Benefits

    Relocation and Employment

    We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

    Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, UAE.

    What You Can Expect

    • We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
    • A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
    • You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
    • Participation in the company‚Äôs employee stock options program.


    We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

    If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Work model: 4 days per week in the office in Lisbon in the first 3 to 6-months. After the 3 to 6-months passes to 3 days per week in the office and 2 days at home

Work schedule: we work under two different schedules. This work schedule provides 12 additional Compensation Days in addition to the normal holiday days. These are fixed days during national holiday periods (5 days between Christmas and New Year's Eve, 5 days during Easter, and 2 days during Carnival)
During Winter (From October to May - 8 months) we work 43 hours/week:
During Summer (From June to September - 4 months) we work 39 hours/week:
Required qualifications to be successful in this role (4/5 years for Senior Profiles):
The candidate must have at least one higher education degree (Must).
Experience in SQL and PLSQL and ability to write and understand queries (Must).
Knowledge in programming languages (Procedural Programming or Object-Oriented Programming).
English proficiency should be at least B2 level.
They must have been living in Portugal for at least 1 and a half years (Must).
Role model mindset, experience in onboarding junior team members, and used to do technical support of team members.
Passion for learning and growing as a developer.
Experience working in an Agile environment and Scrum methodologies.
Great team spirit, independency, pleasant attitude, great openness, and curiosity to learn.

We want to reinforce that candidates must have strong technical skills, a team-oriented attitude, and a youthful spirit. For Senior profiles, candidates must be able to coach and support junior team members, and for Lead profiles, candidates should have experience in the onboarding of junior team members, and they should be seen as a role model for the rest of the team.

Our nearshore expertise sets us apart. We specialize in scalable, on-demand tech talent and operational excellence, helping global partners turn data into business value.
We‚Äôre now expanding our engineering team with a highly technical and impactful role:
üíº We are looking for a Data Engineer (GraphDB) ‚Äì Hybrid Lisbon or Porto
to lead the design, development, and operation of a Network Digital Twin powered by cutting-edge graph database technologies.
If you‚Äôre passionate about complex data modeling, network intelligence, graph architectures, and automation ‚Äî this challenge is for you!
‚úÖ Design and implement a scalable Network Digital Twin using graph databases (Neo4j, AWS Neptune, Spanner DB)
‚úÖ Model multi-domain topologies ‚Äî physical, logical, virtual ‚Äî including resources, services, devices, and relationships
‚úÖ Develop real-time and batch ingestion pipelines from inventory systems, assurance platforms, telemetry streams, and orchestration systems
‚úÖ Define and execute Cypher, Gremlin ou SPARQL queries for analytics, RCA, and network impact assessment
‚úÖ Integrate the digital twin with TMF APIs, SNMP, Kafka, REST APIs ensuring data integrity and consistency
‚úÖ Contribute to graph ontology/taxonomy design, metadata tagging, and domain-specific extensions
‚úÖ Collaborate with AI/ML teams to enable predictive models for anomaly detection, capacity forecasting, and failure prevention
‚úÖ Build dashboards and visualizations to explore and interact with the digital twin
‚úÖ Ensure data security, access control, and compliance across all graph-driven components.
üéØ Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs in Computer Science, Network Engineering, Data Engineering, or similar

üéØ OSS/BSS, network inventory systems, or digital twins
üéØ ETL pipelines, Kafka, NiFi, or Apache Camel
üéØ Background in Python, Java ou Scala
üéØ TMF APIs (TMF638, TMF640, TMF633) is a plus
üéØ Graph visualization tools such as Neo4j Bloom, GraphXR, Gephi.
‚≠ê Background in telecom or large-scale network environments
‚≠ê Understanding of AI/ML applied to graph data
‚≠ê Exposure to Enterprise Knowledge Graphs or Digital Twin frameworks

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJ√°.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across four markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.
You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.
Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our four markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium and Greece)!

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.
Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:
Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

About us

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJ√°.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across four markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.

What we offer you

You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.

Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our four markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium and Greece)!

Your Responsibilities

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:

  • Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
  • Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
  • Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
  • Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
  • Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
  • Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
  • Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
  • Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
  • Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
  • EU work permit is required

Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>
Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2-3 days a week from the office)
SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in the field of consent management platforms (CMP). We follow our company vision to build a world where user privacy enables a thriving digital ecosystem. Our mission is to provide privacy solutions that empower organizations to embrace data privacy while building trust with their users through freedom of choice. With our product, businesses can collect, manage and document user consents on websites and apps, and achieve full compliance in accordance with global privacy regulations while facilitating high consent rates and building trust with their customers.

We are looking for a Tracking Specialist to own and oversee all tracking foundations across the company. This pivotal role will ensure we capture the right data points across product, website, and other digital touchpoints, enabling reliable analytics and insights that drive business impact.

As the Tracking Specialist, you will work closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Data teams to define, implement, and maintain a comprehensive tracking strategy. You will play a vital role in ensuring data quality and consistency, empowering the organization to make confident, data-driven decisions in a fast-scaling B2B SaaS environment.
Define and maintain the company-wide tracking framework, ensuring scalable and consistent practices
Oversee tracking implementation across product, website, and other digital properties
Guarantee that the right data points are captured to support KPIs, product analytics, marketing attribution, and experimentation
Collaborate with Product and Engineering to ensure accurate event tracking and instrumentation
Work with Marketing and Growth teams to validate tracking of campaigns, funnels, and user journeys
Maintain clear and accessible documentation of tracking schemas, events, and data flows
Monitor and validate tracking data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.
Establish best practices for event naming, structure, and governance
Partner with BI and DataOps to align tracking data with warehouse models and KPIs
Act as the subject matter expert for tracking across the company
Provide feedback to Product teams to ensure tracking supports feature adoption and user behavior analysis
Partner with BI to ensure tracking aligns with reporting and insights needs
Proven experience in tracking and analytics implementation, ideally in a SaaS B2B environment
Hands-on experience with Amplitude or similar product analytics platforms (e.g., Mixpanel, Heap)
Strong understanding of tracking concepts (events, properties, schemas, user identification)
Familiarity with marketing and web tracking (Google Tag Manager, Segment, GA4, etc.)
Experience collaborating with Product, Engineering, and Data teams to ensure correct instrumentation
Strong attention to detail, documentation skills, and ability to ensure data quality

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online

You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2-3 days a week from the office)

Company Overview

team.blue is an ecosystem of successful brands working together across regions to provide customers with everything they need to succeed online. 60+ successful brands make up the group
column2:
with a team of 2.700 experts serving its 3.3 million customers across Europe and beyond.

team.blue's brands are a mix of traditional hosting businesses, offering services from domain names, email, shared hosting, e-commerce and server hosting solutions and specialist SaaS providers offering adjacent products such as compliance, marketing tools and team collaboration products. This broad product offering makes it a one-stop partner for online businesses and entrepreneurs across Europe.

‚ÄØ Position Overview‚ÄØ

We are seeking a Data Engineer to join our team to support the implementation of the new ERP System and integrate data from all of the companies billing, payroll and customer billing systems. The ideal candidate will have strong data engineering and data integration experience, with the ability to work hands-on and actively support the setup of the new Center, with a strong drive to support ongoing process improvements.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ingest data from various sources.
  • Ensure data quality, integrity, and reliability through testing and validation.
  • Support the management and optimization of databricks unity catalogs and delta tables
  • Monitor and maintain query performance and security.
  • Develop APIs and other interfaces for data access and manipulation.
  • Generate reports and visualizations to communicate data insights and pipeline performance.
  • Provide technical support for data-related issues and troubleshoot problems as they arise.


Qualifications:

Educational Background:

  • Bachelor's degree in IT/Computer Science
column3:
Data Science or related field


Technical Skills:

  • Experience with Databricks or it‚Äôs related technologies (e.g.Apache Spark, Delta tables, Unity Catalogs) is desirable
  • Basic understanding of cloud platforms and services (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).


Analytical Skills:

  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to analyze complex data sets and identify patterns or anomalies


Soft Skills:

  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Engineer. You‚Äôll work closely with our CTO, CPO, and product teams to architect, build, and deliver robust data pipelines and transformations for our always-on AI platform. Success in this role will have a direct, measurable impact on business outcomes and future product velocity.
Architect, build, and optimize scalable end-to-end data pipelines using dbt and our stack (Python microservices, Postgres, BigQuery, and GCP).
Design, implement, and maintain ETL/ELT processes to ingest, clean, and transform large datasets from a variety of sources.
Collaborate with product and engineering to define data requirements for new product features and analytics initiatives.
Manage our data pipeline by onboarding new clients, loading their data, and applying all required formulas.
Maintain and troubleshoot workflows by fixing broken formulas, adding new services, and ensuring reliable, high-throughput performance.
Ensure data reliability, integrity, and security at scale.
Troubleshoot, performance-tune, and document all pipelines and data workflows for smooth handoff.
5+ years of hands-on experience building production-grade data pipelines, ETL/ELT workflows, and transformed datasets at scale.

column2: strong experience with dbt, Postgres, BigQuery, and core GCP data services (e.g., Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Storage, Composer).

Startup or contract/consulting experience strongly preferred
column2: you move quickly and commit to clear deliverables and deadlines.

Data Engineer | Matter

About The Role

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Engineer. You‚Äôll work closely with our CTO, CPO, and product teams to architect, build, and deliver robust data pipelines and transformations for our always-on AI platform. Success in this role will have a direct, measurable impact on business outcomes and future product velocity.

Key Responsibilities

  • Architect, build, and optimize scalable end-to-end data pipelines using dbt and our stack (Python microservices, Postgres, BigQuery, and GCP).
  • Design, implement, and maintain ETL/ELT processes to ingest, clean, and transform large datasets from a variety of sources.
  • Collaborate with product and engineering to define data requirements for new product features and analytics initiatives.
  • Manage our data pipeline by onboarding new clients, loading their data, and applying all required formulas.
  • Maintain and troubleshoot workflows by fixing broken formulas, adding new services, and ensuring reliable, high-throughput performance.
  • Ensure data reliability, integrity, and security at scale.
  • Troubleshoot, performance-tune, and document all pipelines and data workflows for smooth handoff.

About You

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience building production-grade data pipelines, ETL/ELT workflows, and transformed datasets at scale.
  • Expert-level Python
column2:
strong experience with dbt, Postgres, BigQuery, and core GCP data services (e.g., Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Storage, Composer).
  • Demonstrated experience architecting, optimizing, and troubleshooting cloud-based data infrastructure.
  • Familiarity with analytics, BI tools, and data visualization platforms is a plus.
  • Startup or contract/consulting experience strongly preferred
column3:
you move quickly and commit to clear deliverables and deadlines.

4335664110,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/risk-gf-senior-data-analyst-at-bnp-paribas-cib-4335664110?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=JR60EBosH%2FixGIxvpY%2FoPw%3D%3D,RISK GF Senior Data Analyst,BNP Paribas CIB,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","About The Job

Within the BNP Paribas Group RISK function, the RISK SGCP (Strategic Governance and Credit Platform) team is responsible among others, for leading and maintaining the Strategic Risk Governance Framework of the Group in close collaboration with the RISK Hubs, RISK Business Lines, and other RISK teams, enabling decisions on risk appetite and defining orientations on commercial strategies and corresponding risk policies
By integrating the Data Management team, the RISK GF Senior Data Analyst works in a best-in-class data management team, in an international and dynamic environment

The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) and Tableau are used as end user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines and Dashboards respectively
IT solutions are granted by ITG, the IT entity servicing BNPP Group Functions. ITG supports the infrastructure on a daily-basis and helps with backend big data engineering and framework maintenance

The primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, notably to present data in valuable ways to see beyond the figures. Added value data visualizations are key for the SGCP department functional analysts to perform the credit portfolio analysis, notably Risk Appetite Statement monitoring of key sectors for the Group, Risk Weighted Asset assessment and explanation, amongst others
You will be in regular contact with the various SGCP teams in Lisbon, Paris and other regions, as well with partner RISK teams and ITG
Frame, design, implement, test, and deliver agile, innovative, and robust data visualization solutions to meet the needs of RISK users, with priority for RISK SGCP (CPA, SRA, and CRF teams)
Contribute to the rationalization and functional optimization of dashboards and their accessibility
Be proactive in proposing evolutions to implement in the data sources to simplify data models and facilitate exploitation by users as well as performance
Implement and maintain the technical and functional documentation of tools and processes
Work closely with data engineers to evolve the data foundation in line with the use cases of data visualization
Assess the integration of new features in data visualization tools and ensure technological watch around data visualization
Bring support as a data visualization expert to team members in Paris, Lisbon, and the regions
Train and coach as necessary more junior team members in new data visualization technologies and best practices
Contribute to ‚Äúdata‚Äù projects on various internal and regulatory credit risk topics (Credit Chain, B-Ready and Reboot‚Ä¶)
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas and RISK notably
Regularly update the management of the department of progress achieved
Master‚Äôs in Information Technology / Computer Science / Data Science / Mathematics and Statistics or related
At least 3 years of experience in Data Visualization / Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Communication skills, both written and oral
BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions
Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.
To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal
Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

About The Job

  • Within the BNP Paribas Group RISK function, the RISK SGCP (Strategic Governance and Credit Platform) team is responsible among others, for leading and maintaining the Strategic Risk Governance Framework of the Group in close collaboration with the RISK Hubs, RISK Business Lines, and other RISK teams, enabling decisions on risk appetite and defining orientations on commercial strategies and corresponding risk policies
  • By integrating the Data Management team, the RISK GF Senior Data Analyst works in a best-in-class data management team, in an international and dynamic environment
  • The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) and Tableau are used as end user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines and Dashboards respectively
  • IT solutions are granted by ITG, the IT entity servicing BNPP Group Functions. ITG supports the infrastructure on a daily-basis and helps with backend big data engineering and framework maintenance
  • The primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, notably to present data in valuable ways to see beyond the figures. Added value data visualizations are key for the SGCP department functional analysts to perform the credit portfolio analysis, notably Risk Appetite Statement monitoring of key sectors for the Group, Risk Weighted Asset assessment and explanation, amongst others
  • You will be in regular contact with the various SGCP teams in Lisbon, Paris and other regions, as well with partner RISK teams and ITG

Your Main Activities Are

  • Frame, design, implement, test, and deliver agile, innovative, and robust data visualization solutions to meet the needs of RISK users, with priority for RISK SGCP (CPA, SRA, and CRF teams)
  • Contribute to the rationalization and functional optimization of dashboards and their accessibility
  • Be proactive in proposing evolutions to implement in the data sources to simplify data models and facilitate exploitation by users as well as performance
  • Implement and maintain the technical and functional documentation of tools and processes
  • Work closely with data engineers to evolve the data foundation in line with the use cases of data visualization
  • Assess the integration of new features in data visualization tools and ensure technological watch around data visualization
  • Bring support as a data visualization expert to team members in Paris, Lisbon, and the regions
  • Train and coach as necessary more junior team members in new data visualization technologies and best practices
  • Contribute to ‚Äúdata‚Äù projects on various internal and regulatory credit risk topics (Credit Chain, B-Ready and Reboot‚Ä¶)
  • Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas and RISK notably
  • Regularly update the management of the department of progress achieved

Profile and Skills to Success

  • Master‚Äôs in Information Technology / Computer Science / Data Science / Mathematics and Statistics or related
  • At least 3 years of experience in Data Visualization / Data Analytics or similar
  • Advanced level of English, both written and oral
  • Knowledge in
    • Tableau Suite (Desktop, Server)
    • SQL
    • Dataiku
    • Python
  • Attention to detail / rigor
  • Ability to manage a project
  • Ability to synthetise / simplify
  • Analytical ability
  • Communication skills, both written and oral
Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines

4347535540,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/product-analyst-at-air-apps-4347535540?position=60&pageNum=0&refId=M%2B9TXVUMWgxaMUJbpeu63g%3D%3D&trackingId=Mexf4t8b8LngOE1mdCDptg%3D%3D,Product Analyst,Air Apps,"Lisboa, Lisbon, Portugal","About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal, in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.
Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

As a Product Analyst at Air Apps, you will analyze both internal and external products to identify potential new functionalities, uncover bottlenecks, and provide data-driven insights to enhance user experience. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to interpret product performance, optimize features, and support strategic decision-making through actionable recommendations.
Analyze product usage data to identify trends, friction points, and opportunities for improvement.
Evaluate competitor products to benchmark functionalities and propose innovative solutions.
Develop reports and dashboards to track key performance metrics.
Collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to enhance product features based on data insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to validate new functionalities and improve user engagement.
Provide actionable insights to support product roadmap decisions.
Identify and address bottlenecks in user flows and product performance.
Around 3+ years of experience in product analytics, business intelligence, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis.
Proficiency with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude).
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
Strong communication skills to present insights clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Top-tier Health and Life Insurance for peace of mind.
Transportation Budget to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.
Pension Fund to support your long-term financial planning.
Urban Sports Club membership to keep you active.

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal &
column2:
Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal, in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Product Analyst at Air Apps, you will analyze both internal and external products to identify potential new functionalities, uncover bottlenecks, and provide data-driven insights to enhance user experience. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to interpret product performance, optimize features, and support strategic decision-making through actionable recommendations.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze product usage data to identify trends, friction points, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Evaluate competitor products to benchmark functionalities and propose innovative solutions.
  • Develop reports and dashboards to track key performance metrics.
  • Collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to enhance product features based on data insights.
  • Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to validate new functionalities and improve user engagement.
  • Provide actionable insights to support product roadmap decisions.
  • Identify and address bottlenecks in user flows and product performance.

Requirements

  • Around 3+ years of experience in product analytics, business intelligence, or a related field.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis.
  • Proficiency with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude).
  • Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
  • Strong communication skills to present insights clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.

What benefits are we offering?

  • Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
  • Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
  • Annual Bonus
  • Top-tier Health and Life Insurance for peace of mind.
  • Transportation Budget to support your commute needs.
  • Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
  • Childcare support.
  • Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.
  • Pension Fund to support your long-term financial planning.
  • Urban Sports Club membership to keep you active.
  • Meals 100% free at the hub.

Diversity &
column3:
Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

Job Description:

The Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide actionable insights for business decisions. The role involves creating and managing data pipelines using Airflow for data extraction, processing, and loading, ensuring their maintenance, monitoring, and stability. The analyst will work closely with end-users and other teams to provide accessible and reliable data

Main Tasks

  • Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing and loading
  • Responsible for code and query optimization
  • Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks
  • Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users
  • Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost.

Qualifications

Technical Skills:

  • Python
  • Experience in creating APIs in Python
  • PySpark
  • SQL, Oracle Data Base
  • Experience with Data Warehouses
  • Apache Airflow - Experience in pipeline development
  • Git
  • Agile methodologies

Language Skills

  • English ‚Äì Practice

Soft Skills

  • Good communication skills
  • Strong analytical abilities, able to have the right synthesis and all possible details at same timee required soft skills
  • Adaptability skills
  • Team spirit
  • Client Focus

4341120685,https://pt.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-decskill-4341120685?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=u2jPns31iBoV3N4wO48mig%3D%3D&trackingId=1GsocUlDvs2ZLd0Tg1MY%2FQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Decskill,Lisbon Metropolitan Area,"Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.
DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams

DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed
DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.

Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.
We are looking for an Data Analyst!
To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.

As a Data Analyst, will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing, and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). Will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem-solving skills.

Will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions.

Will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
Must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges.
Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields.
Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI.
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas).
Ability to analyze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus.
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.
Proven ability to work in an Agile/Scrum development environment.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.
Proactive and flexible approach to dealing with challenges.
If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/Data Analyst""

Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

  • DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams
column2: • DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed
column3:
• DECSKILL CONNECT through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for an Data Analyst!


Responsibilities:

  • To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.
  • As a Data Analyst, will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing, and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). Will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem-solving skills.
  • Will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions.
  • Will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders.
  • Must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges.


Requirements:

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields.
  • Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas).
  • Proficiency in SQL.
  • Ability to analyze, synthetize and simplify.
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.
  • CI/CD tools (Practice).
  • Cloud Architecture (Expert).
  • Sonar (Practice).
  • Proven ability to work in an Agile/Scrum development environment.
  • Problem Solving and critical thinking.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Team work and collaboration.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.
  • Proactive and flexible approach to dealing with challenges.
  • Good Level of english.


If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/Data Analyst""


Thank You! üòä


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project based in Lisbon (2x/Week).


Requirements:

  • Minimum of 3 years experience as a Data Analyst.
  • Experience in creating APIs in Python.
  • Proficiency in SQL Server, Oracle Database.
  • Knowledge with Pyspark and Airflow.
  • Experience with Data Warehouses.
  • Experience with Git and Agile methodologies.
  • Good level of English is mandatory.


Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for creating data pipelines in Airflow for data extracting, processing and loading.
