  • Responsible for generating insights and identify trends, anomalies or opportunities to improve users experience and anticipate their daily tasks.
  • Responsible for delivering data in useful and appealing ways to users.
  • Responsible for understanding business change and requirement needs, assess the impact and the cost.

Join us at Closer Consulting! üöÄ


Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?


Founded in 2006 with the mission ""To Challenge Complexity"", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others ‚Äì, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.


We're looking for a Data Analyst ready to take on new challenges with our Closer team! üöÄ


üåç Hybrid work model: 2 days per week onsite in Lisbon.


Are you the one?


üí° Main Responsibilities


Requirements Gathering and Definition

  • Identify and understand the organization‚Äôs data needs across different business areas.
  • Extract data from commercial and analytical systems for ad hoc analysis.
  • Define technical and functional requirements for the evolution of the Data Warehouse / Datahub-C.


Data Modeling and Structuring

  • Design and structure data models ensuring quality, integrity, and consistency.
  • Build data products that enable relationships between different business assets.


Data Analysis and Business Support

  • Conduct business analyses to support decision-making processes.
  • Perform data extractions and generate reports to assist operations.
  • Identify data-driven solutions to address stakeholder needs.


Stakeholder Management and Communication

  • Manage and communicate with stakeholders involved in data initiatives.
  • Translate insights into actionable recommendations for business areas.


üß† Required Skills


Technical

  • Advanced proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
  • Solid understanding of the utilities sector, ensuring alignment between data and strategic objectives.


Analytical

  • Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.
  • Critical thinking and problem-solving orientation.


Behavioral

  • Proactive approach to identifying opportunities and solving problems.
  • Excellent communication skills to bridge technical and business perspectives.
  • Strong organization and prioritization skills to manage multiple initiatives effectively.


We believe we are the ones to, by:


  • Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
  • Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
  • Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
  • Providing you with a custom training plan.
  • Helping you reach happiness.


Oh‚Ä¶ and by the way, we also have:


  • Several challenging complex projects.
  • Stimulating teams and leaders.
  • World-class Clients and Partners.


If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.


Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.


At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

At PMI, we‚Äôve chosen to do something incredible.
We‚Äôre totally transforming our business and building our future on smoke-free products with the power to deliver a smoke-free future

With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you‚Äôll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and you will have the space to move your career forward in many different areas/directions.

Working within the Enterprise Data and Analytics organization as a data analyst, joining with a high-level perspective and customer insight to deliver on the goals, vision, and roadmap for metadata and catalog product development, quality, master and reference data including technical and business metadata, tagging, lineage, quality, reporting, master data, and issue resolution.
Taking responsibility for communicating with stakeholders across the board, including customers, business managers, delivery teams and external partners
column2: ensuring goals are clear, and the vision is aligned with business objectives.

column1: Delivering on data services within the data management lifecycle
column2: measuring its impact and outcomes on business objectives.

column1: HOW CAN YOU MAKE HISTORY WITH US?
Responsible for backlog delivery in the context of project, capability, and business as usually focused work. Collaborating with stakeholders to right size the backlog and roadmap.
Responsible for working with the product owner and stakeholders to define and implement standardized metadata framework attributes in the catalog (business, technical, tagging, ownership, etc.).
Responsible for data quality dashboarding, ensuring stakeholder expectations are accounted for and met in support of error detection and issue resolution.
Responsible for ensuring that deployed data quality rule results are deployed timely, accurately, and consistently and in a manner that meets governance needs for issue resolution processes.
Monitor outcomes, taking appropriate remedial action where necessary.
Responsible for partnering with stakeholder organizations to solicit requirements and action them within the catalog.
Responsible for training stakeholders on the enterprise catalog and data quality as it relates to use and value proposition to their given persona context.
Adhere to principles, policies and standards to achieve quality and compliance of solution and services
column2: providing advice on policy when necessary

column1: Analyze, collect requirements, guide, and build within in our master and reference data platform

Drive collaboration and knowledge sharing with colleagues in IT and other functions on matters such as applicable principles, practices, standards, procedures and guidelines, efficient use of tools and technologies.
Ensure that business objectives and requirements are clearly understood.
Provide information and business advice to resolve complex or contentious queries and issues
column2: enabling others to take appropriate actions.

column1: Create and maintain system/services documentation, training programs/materials, operating manuals with assigned scope
University degree in Computer Sciences / Information Technology / Engineering / Business Administration with additional certificates
2+ years of experience in Information Technology or Business Function in multinational company.
Customer Experiences Implementation, Consumer Centricity Expert, and Stakeholder Relationship Management
Data Cataloging, Data Quality, Master Data, and Reference Data
DAMA CDMP Fundamentals certification would be an additional benefit

Professional qualification and education support possibility
Free bike and car parking for all employees.

WHO WE ARE?

At PMI, we‚Äôve chosen to do something incredible.

We‚Äôre totally transforming our business and building our future on smoke-free products with the power to deliver a smoke-free future

With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you‚Äôll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and you will have the space to move your career forward in many different areas/directions.

WHAT'S THE ROLE?

Working within the Enterprise Data and Analytics organization as a data analyst, joining with a high-level perspective and customer insight to deliver on the goals, vision, and roadmap for metadata and catalog product development, quality, master and reference data including technical and business metadata, tagging, lineage, quality, reporting, master data, and issue resolution.

Taking responsibility for communicating with stakeholders across the board, including customers, business managers, delivery teams and external partners
column2:
ensuring goals are clear, and the vision is aligned with business objectives.

Delivering on data services within the data management lifecycle
column3:
measuring its impact and outcomes on business objectives.

HOW CAN YOU MAKE HISTORY WITH US?

  • Responsible for backlog delivery in the context of project, capability, and business as usually focused work. Collaborating with stakeholders to right size the backlog and roadmap.
  • Responsible for working with the product owner and stakeholders to define and implement standardized metadata framework attributes in the catalog (business, technical, tagging, ownership, etc.).
  • Responsible for data quality dashboarding, ensuring stakeholder expectations are accounted for and met in support of error detection and issue resolution.
  • Responsible for ensuring that deployed data quality rule results are deployed timely, accurately, and consistently and in a manner that meets governance needs for issue resolution processes.
  • Monitor outcomes, taking appropriate remedial action where necessary.
  • Responsible for partnering with stakeholder organizations to solicit requirements and action them within the catalog.
  • Responsible for training stakeholders on the enterprise catalog and data quality as it relates to use and value proposition to their given persona context.
  • Adhere to principles, policies and standards to achieve quality and compliance of solution and services
column4:
providing advice on policy when necessary
  • Analyze, collect requirements, guide, and build within in our master and reference data platform
  • Drive collaboration and knowledge sharing with colleagues in IT and other functions on matters such as applicable principles, practices, standards, procedures and guidelines, efficient use of tools and technologies.
  • Ensure that business objectives and requirements are clearly understood.
  • Provide information and business advice to resolve complex or contentious queries and issues
column5:
enabling others to take appropriate actions.
  • Create and maintain system/services documentation, training programs/materials, operating manuals with assigned scope

    • WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

    • University degree in Computer Sciences / Information Technology / Engineering / Business Administration with additional certificates
    • 2+ years of experience in Information Technology or Business Function in multinational company.
    • Customer Experiences Implementation, Consumer Centricity Expert, and Stakeholder Relationship Management
    • Data Cataloging, Data Quality, Master Data, and Reference Data
    • Data and Analytics Literacy
    • DAMA CDMP Fundamentals certification would be an additional benefit
    • AWS - Cloud Practitioner certification would be an additional benefit

    WHAT CAN WE OFFER YOU?

    • Private medical and dental care, life insurance
    • Hybrid work opportunity and flexible working arrangements
    • Employee pension plan
    • Multisport program
    • Professional qualification and education support possibility
    • Trainings and Language classes
    • Holiday, Cultural and Christmas bonus
    • Free bike and car parking for all employees.

    Please note that only online applications will be taken into consideration and only selected candidates will be contacted.

Macrobond is a leading provider of global economic and financial data and technology for investment professionals. Our customers include over 900 firms spanning the buyside, sell side, corporate and academic sectors.

Our platform, rich in intellectual property and supported by a rapidly expanding global team, ensures we remain at the forefront of our industry. With the backing of Francisco Partners, a prominent global tech investment firm, we operate as a truly international company. Our headquarters are in Malm√∂, Sweden, and we have key offices in Gothenburg, London, Poland, Lisbon, Hong Kong, and New York.

As Data Specialist in one of our teams, you‚Äôll be responsible for maintaining and expanding macroeconomic content in the Macrobond application. Your work will be focused on sourcing data from national, international & private data sources, as well as performing database administration. Please note that you may be assigned to a junior, regular, or senior role based on your skills and experience.
Collecting, processing & entering macroeconomic data in the Macrobond database in an accurate and timely way.
Use economic knowledge to identify trends and ensure quality of data.
Communicating with sources to ensure that data is maintained at a high standard.
Finding & defining opportunities to improve work processes (data collection automation & structuring).
Cooperating with other team members & your team leader.
University degree (Bachelor or above), preferably in Economics, Statistics, Finance, or related field.
Experience in a role related to macroeconomic/financial data analysis will be an asset.
Advanced knowledge of English (other languages are a plus).
Good practical knowledge of MS Excel.
High attention to detail and an analytical mind.
Permit to live/work in Portugal (if foreigner).
Availability to work in shifts 1 -2 weeks per month (14:00-23:00/15:00 - 00:00).
Opportunities for learning, career development and expanding your knowledge base.
A chance to contribute to a growing business.
Private health insurance, other benefits & training possibilities.
Hybrid work model (remote work up to 40%, and 50% for late shift).
A modern office in the city center.

At Macrobond, diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to our culture and success. We are committed to fostering an environment where all individuals are respected, valued, and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By joining our team, you become part of an organization that believes diversity drives innovation and strengthens our collective performance. Apply today and be part of our ongoing journey of growth and inclusion.
